response.original_title: Television Pioneer: The Story of Ross K. Bagwell, Sr.
response.overview: A man, Ross K. Bagwell, Sr. sees a TV broadcast for the first time in 1951 and pursues a career in the television industry at all costs.  Through perseverance and the support of his family he single-handily makes Knoxville, Tennessee the unlikely center for television production providing thousands of hours of programing for the emerging cable industry.  Directed by: Kristen Dye
response.tagline: The true story of the man who revolutionized mass production of quality television prorams.
response.title: Television Pioneer: The Story of Ross K. Bagwell, Sr.
